definition: to point out

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Already scholars point to troubling signs.
sentences.chinese: 已经有学者点明了令人不安的迹象。

sentences.english: This statement throws light on the symbolic implications of art.
sentences.chinese: 这些叙述点明了艺术表达的象征性的含义。

sentences.english: At last the advantages of electric melting method is stated.
sentences.chinese: 最后点明电熔法的优点。

sentences.english: Is beneath pure heart, but it never is highlighted.
sentences.chinese: 内心是澄净的，却从不点明。

definition: to point out/to indicate
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
vague/ambiguous/veiled/obscure
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
intention/purpose
to understand clearly/to be clear about/plain/clear/also written 明瞭|明了[ming2 liao3]
to understand clearly/to be clear about/plain/clear
abundantly clear
to explain
concise and comprehensive (idiom)
to understand/to comprehend/to grasp
to elucidate/to explain clearly/to expound
